newsitem.title: UK: UK govt, banks fail to agree on student loans.
newsitem.headline: UK govt, banks fail to agree on student loans.

text.p: The government said on Wednesday it was postponing plans to allow private sector banks to give loans to British university students alongside its own Student Loans Company after talks with three potential lenders.

Education and Employment Secretary Gillian Shephard said in a statement the talks with Barclays Plc, National Home Loans Holdings Plc and Clydesdale Bank Plc, in which they had put forward bids, had not succeeded.
"We have not been able to agree a deal which would meet their requirements at the right price for the taxpayer," she said.
Shephard said that instead, the government planned to sell part of the two billion stg of outstanding student loans to the private sector.
A spokeswoman in her department said the government had not yet determined how much of the loans would be disposed of.
Opposition Labour Party higher education spokesman Bryan Davies said Shephard's statement represented "a complete collapse of the Government's plans for student loans".
